snippet: Setbacks on detention issues that have created tension between the countries, and to years of international efforts to promote humane treatment of prisoners.
abstract: United States military suspends transfer of detainees to some Afghan prisons out of concern over continuing human rights abuses and torture; American-led coalition has asked Afghan government to investigate allegations of torture by Afghan Local Police units.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed and Habib Zahori contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Setbacks on detention issues that have created tension between the countries, and to years of international efforts to promote humane treatment of prisoners.

headline.seo: U.S. Military Stops Sending Some Detainees to Afghan Custody
headline.main: U.S. Military Stops Sending Detainees to Some Afghan Prisons on Rights Fears
headline.print_headline: U.S. Military Stops Sending Detainees to Some Afghan Prisons on Rights Fears

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
